intro: Cyclophorus beddomeanus, commonly known as the Beddome's cyclophorus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found growing in rocky crevices or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
